--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Dennis Hotson <dwh@m...> wrote:
> On Wed, 2005-05-11 at 12:35 +1000, Dennis Hotson wrote:
> > I've been looking at heritrix for about a week now and it's working
> > really well. I've got it crawling and inserting pages into a database.
> > 
> > I'm just wondering what kind of scheduling functionality is
available in
> > heritrix.
> > For example.. is there a way to schedule a job to run at 2:00 AM
every 3
> > days? 
> 
> 
> Ok.. I've been doing some more investigation and I'm thinking of using
> another java scheduler (http://www.opensymphony.com/quartz/) and I was
> thinking of setting up jobs in heritrix via the JMX interface.
> The only problem is that the JMX interface appears to be quite primitive
> in comparison to the web interface. :P

Yes. But we intend fixing this real soon (Check HEAD. 
Enabling/disabling 'crawling' mode and adding jobs have just been
added to the JMX vocabulary).

> Are there plans to improve the functionality of the JMX interface? If
> not.. How hard would it be to do it myself?
> 
Improving the JMX remote control facility in Heritrix is a priority
for us here at the archive.  At a minimum we look at is as core to our
multimachine strategy.

This issue, '[ 1173597 ] jmx api'
(https://sourceforge.net/tracker/?group_id=73833&atid=539102&func=detail&aid=1173597),
has coarse notes on what we're thinking of adding.  Is there anything
that you'd add to this list? 

Other general thoughts on the JMX strategy would be:
+ Should be possible to run a 'headless' Heritrix -- i.e. no Web UI --
and be able to do all via JMX that you can from the Web UI (This is a
ways off but when in place, would make sense to move the WUI to go via
JMX).
+ To keep to OpenMBeans, if at all possible, so we're explicit that no
need to load clients w/ Heritrix-particular classes undoing involved
JMX operation returns: e.g. Frontier reports, etc. (I was going to
make a start on converting current, basic API to OpenMBean from
StandardMBeans this week, time permitting).

Anything else we should consider?

St.Ack
